item.title: South Korean Regulator Designates Crypto Exchange Bithumb as a Conglomerate
item.description:
The South Korean Fair Trade Commission (FTC) has classified the crypto exchange Bithumb as a conglomerate. The designation will force the company to adhere to a range of financial compliance rules.

item.title: Cai Wensheng Pays 20% Premium, Bets $84M on Hong Kong AI-Web3 Hub
item.description:
Cai Wensheng has secured the 53k-sq-ft PARK AURA tower in Hong Kong’s Tin Hau for about US$84 million, a 20 percent premium on local deals. He has outlined redevelopment that includes an AI-themed café, rent-free co-working floors for local founders and dedicated studios for AI and Web3 projects.

The post Cai Wensheng Pays 20% Premium, Bets $84M on Hong Kong AI-Web3 Hub appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Tether Rakes in Record $1B Q1 Profit—46M Wallet Surge Fuels $120B Treasury Bet
item.description:
Tether has posted Q1 2025 profit above $1 billion, backed by $120 billion in U.S. Treasuries and gold gains. Assets exceed liabilities by $5.6 billion. USDT supply has added $7 billion and 46 million wallets. The issuer has obtained licensing in El Salvador and outlined a planned U.S.-focused token.

The post Tether Rakes in Record $1B Q1 Profit—46M Wallet Surge Fuels $120B Treasury Bet appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: UK Fintech Losing Spark as Crypto Heavyweights Seek Faster Shores
item.description:
UK Fintech leaders warn the country could lose its edge as slow licensing, unresolved stablecoin guidance and limited pension fund backing have impeded startups. Coinbase and Ripple say firms have redirected product development and fundraising to the EU, Singapore and the US.

The post UK Fintech Losing Spark as Crypto Heavyweights Seek Faster Shores appeared first on Cryptonews.
